Updated the Spaceport file again.

Fixed:

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Some code was causing a tiny bit of lag while landing.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The included Shark aircraft had no ladder. The ladder is now hidden near the air intake on the top of the plane... yes it's awkward. but it works!

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Increased the strength of the front of the Shark so it's less likely to break on landing.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Added the the other Wasp aircraft to include it in the main pack.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Updated the included readme file.

If you want to update, you should just remove the R3 folder from the GameData directory and then unpack the new one. You can overwrite if you wish...

This update will not impact your saved games.

Edited June 16, 2013 by InfiniteDice

I downloaded this back when it was for .19 and I must say it didn't work for me at all. I had no propulsion none of the features worked, has it been improved or can anyone verify that it is working considerably well?

I downloaded this back when it was for .19 and I must say it didn't work for me at all. I had no propulsion none of the features worked, has it been improved or can anyone verify that it is working considerably well?

As long as you read the Guide in the opening post ... everything should work fine. Look up above Khaos even went upside down and backwards without issues. LOL

Ok, I'll give it a try and report back, last time I had issues with no matter what action key ( yes I looked at the key bindings first ) I pressed it wouldn't do jack squat, and I could use this to retrieve splashed down space craft with the Airships mod or with a vtol type craft or something!

The crane should load but to use requires the Infernal robotics fork of Damned Robotics https://github.com/chrisphillips/DRobotics-for-Kerbal-0.20.2

I had Damned Robotics installed prior to installing this... maybe I installed that incorrectly.
How are you guys manoeuvring your aircraft around deck? I make a little tug but since the aircraft wheels point forward it just goes in that direction. Thanks.

After installing this and trying it out, I must say it is amazing! I think all KSP'ers should use this haha! Works great and watching it sink is fun!

One question though... Could you replace the yellow straight docking ports on the deck with standard ones to drop regular craft on? And two, is it possiable change the camera around to get a better view say if your working in the hanger?
Go big or go home... Under construction. The Villainous.

Running sea trials... No docking clamps yet. Just seeing how well she floats and where I need to add struts. Not too many places. Dice and crew has really outdone themselves.

I can nearly land a B9 craft on this thing...

Ok something I noticed on a few landing attempts I thought I'd share with yall. The landing system has a bit or range to its grab. This ended up crashing a couple flights as I tried to land. My approach would be a bit to high, as I started to pull up the hook would start pulling toward the arrestor cable. Not enough to grab the plane to the deck, just enough to point my nose strait up...while I'm under almost no thrust. Both times this happened it ended up the plane flops tail first into the water just past the bow.

Not an issue if your good at landing...if your not so good (like me) and miss DONT PULL UP right away, throttle up then maneuver.

I was using included Shark jet.....it was kinda amussing to watch though....

Running sea trials... No docking clamps yet. Just seeing how well she floats and where I need to add struts. Not too many places. Dice and crew has really outdone themselves.

I can nearly land a B9 craft on this thing...

I updated the pack, or just grab the new Wasp Aircraft file from the first post. It has slower landing capabilities. Everyone flies different, so where one aircraft is difficult to master another might be very easy.

I'm glad it's mostly good comments so far!
Can we perhaps have modular boat parts? The first thing I thought while this was being done was "perhaps a racing boat would be cool and all"
